data.title: Andrey Esipenko BLUNDERED the rook! Wei Yi moves on to World Cup Final!
data.excerpt: The dramatic blunder came in a sudden death tiebreak game, sending the Chinese GM Wei Yi to his first major final.

data.title: World Cup Final: The Battle Begins! Who Lands the First Blow in Game One?
data.excerpt: The two finalists, Wei Yi and Javokhir Sindarov, prepare to face off in the first long-awaited classical game.

data.title: Wei Yi: "It's One of My Biggest Goals in My Chess Career."
data.excerpt: The Chinese Grandmaster discusses the immense pressure and significance of earning a Candidates spot.

data.title: SLU Defeats UTD, Repeats as Collegiate Chess League Champions
data.excerpt: Saint Louis University clinched back-to-back Collegiate Chess League titles with a decisive victory over the University of Texas at Dallas.

data.title: Esipenko Hits Back To Lead Candidates Battle
data.excerpt: GM Andrey Esipenko struck back with a crucial win, reclaiming the lead in the Candidates qualification standings.

data.title: Gurel Cements Status As No. 1 Junior Bullet Brawler
data.excerpt: Turkish prodigy Deniz Gurel reaffirmed his dominance in bullet chess with another string of blisteringly fast wins.

data.title: Duda, Nakamura, Terry Win 3-0 Thursday
data.excerpt: A dominant Thursday saw Duda, Nakamura, and Terry each sweep their matches.

data.title: Firouzja Eliminates Nepomniachtchi, Advances To Semifinal Vs. Nakamura
data.excerpt: Alireza Firouzja knocked out Ian Nepomniachtchi in a fierce tiebreak to set up a blockbuster semifinal against Nakamura.
